additionalnotes.value: Crohn's Disease / Fistulizing Crohn's Disease: followed by additional doses at 2 and 6 weeks after initial dose, then every 8 weeks thereafter. Patients identified as carriers of Hepatitis B virus should be monitored for signs/symptoms of relapse of HBV infection throughout therapy and several months following termination of therapy.

Fistulizing Crohn's Disease in patients no longer responsing to 5 mg/kg treatment. Patients identified as carriers of Hepatitis B virus should be monitored for signs/symptoms of relapse of HBV infection throughout therapy and several months following termination of therapy.

Rheumatoid Arthritis: followed by additional doses at 2 and 6 weeks after initial dose, then every 8 weeks thereafter. Patients identified as carriers of Hepatitis B virus should be monitored for signs/symptoms of relapse of HBV infection throughout therapy and several months following termination of therapy.
